job description:
The DSRD data operations group primary objective is the building and accelerating the reuse of cross domain data and information that enables portfolio decision making. This position will be responsible for working with the data operations lead and other members of the data group within DSRD in executing the strategy developed by the lead and SOE LT.

ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES
  • This position will be using their expertise to support the data operations lead in navigating the existing data framework within DSRD, identify ongoing data initiatives within DSRD and across WRD, and develop new solutions. Will be closely working with partners outside of DSRD such as Business Technology and external vendors.
  • This position will provide technical leadership and expertise required to develop solutions that are geared towards streamlining the data aggregation process, enabling DSRD global line leads and scientists within the lines with access to data in a timely manner and provides high throughput solutions for data visualization.
  • This position will be responsible for creating and sustaining innovative approaches to analyze, transfer, map, catalog, search, configure, and integrate data and information for reuse. Will also be the resident expert of the data systems that are utilized by DSRD and be a close advisor to the data operations lead.
  • Will be responsible for extending and enhancing the current visualization capabilities of the current set of data within DSRD and across WRD.
    • Education:

    Bachelor or (Master or PhD) (preferred) Degree in Biological Sciences, IT, or related field.

    Required:
  • At least 5 years relevant data management, mining, visualization, analysis or reporting experience
  • At least 5 years relevant database programming experience in SQL, SAS, or R, Python programming
  • At least 3 years relevant experience with data visualization tools (SpotFire preferred)
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills needed to interact with business groups globally as well as technical delivery and support teams
  • Ability to present technical information to a non-technical, scientific audience
  • Ability to build and maintain strong relationships with internal technology partners and external vendors
    • Preferred:
  • All or part of relevant experience working with Biopharmaceutical (non)clinical data
  • Solid understanding and experience on Artificial Intelligence, Natural Language Processing, or machine learning projects
  • Knowledge of (non)clinical drug research, development and global regulatory submission processes
  • Relevant experience working in the Amazon Web Service (AWS) environment
  • Thorough understanding of CDISC regulatory requirements and relevant data standards. CDISC knowledge and experience are preferable.
    • Some (5-10%) travel within US to DSRD sites
